channel.title: Khronos Group-relevant MDN issues
channel.description: Issue filed on MDN Web Docs related to pages attached to technologies developed by Khronos Group

item.title: [webgl2] References to undefined constants in WebGL2 docs
item.content:encoded:
MDN URL

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WebGL2RenderingContext/texStorage3D

What specific section or headline is this issue about?

#internalformat

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

The constants gl.RGUI, gl.SRGB_ALPHA8, and gl.RGBA4444 are cited. None of these are defined in https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WebGL_API/Constants.

What did you expect to see?

All constants referred to in the WebGL documentation should be defined in https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WebGL_API/Constants. Either gl.RGUI, gl.SRGB_ALPHA8, and gl.RGBA4444 should be added to that page or removed from https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WebGL2RenderingContext/texStorage3D, https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WebGL2RenderingContext/texImage3D, and https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WebGL2RenderingContext/texSubImage3D.

Do you have any supporting links, references, or citations?

The Khronos WebGL 2 doc defines RG8UI, RG16UI, RG32UI, and SRGB8_ALPHA8. These are very similar to two of the three undefined constants.

Do you have anything more you want to share?

I think a WebGL 2 subject matter expert might be able to sort this out very quickly. I'm afraid I am not very experienced in this area.

item.title: [webgl2] texSubImage3D: Wrong List of Formats
item.content:encoded:
MDN URL

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WebGL2RenderingContext/texSubImage3D#format

What specific section or headline is this issue about?

Parameter format

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

The list of possible enum values under the format parameter is wrong. It lists OpenGL internal formats.

What did you expect to see?

I believe it needs to list OpenGL formats not internal formats.

By experimentation, using the internal format gl.R8 does not work. Chromium gives the error "WebGL: INVALID_ENUM: texSubImage3D: invalid format"

It needs to be the format equivalent, gl.RED, which works correctly, but is not on this list.

Do you have any supporting links, references, or citations?

Following to the specification linked on the MDN page, under the first texSubImage3D overload definition, it states:

The combination of format, type, and WebGLTexture's internal format must be listed in Table 1 or 2 from man page.

This link takes you to the OpenGL specification for glTexImage3D, which lists both internal formats and formats. But comparing with the list of formats in tables 1 and 2 (formats which matches the parameter name, not internal formats), you get the following list:

Table 1

  • GL_RGB
  • GL_RGBA
  • GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA
  • GL_LUMINANCE
  • GL_ALPHA

Table 2

  • GL_RED
  • GL_RED_INTEGER
  • GL_RG
  • GL_RG_INTEGER
  • GL_RGB
  • GL_RGB_INTEGER
  • GL_RGBA
  • GL_RGBA_INTEGER

Do you have anything more you want to share?

Since texSubImage3D is only an upload method, and not a texture configuration method (like texStorage3D / texImage3D) it makes sense that it doesn't require layout configuration.

Even still, I'd prefer that someone else double-check my understanding here. Otherwise, I'd have probably just updated the page myself.

MDN metadata

Page report details
  • Folder: en-us/web/api/webgl2renderingcontext/texsubimage3d
  • MDN URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WebGL2RenderingContext/texSubImage3D
  • GitHub URL: https://github.com/mdn/content/blob/main/files/en-us/web/api/webgl2renderingcontext/texsubimage3d/index.md

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

A GLboolean specifying whether to transpose the matrix. Must be false.

What did you expect to see?

This can be true or false.

item.title: [webgl2, webgl1] `texSubImage2D` documentation does not document the `source`, `srcOffset` parameters
item.content:encoded:
MDN URL

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WebGLRenderingContext/texSubImage2D

What specific section or headline is this issue about?

Parameters

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

There is no documentation for the parameters called source or srcOffset. In particular, the relation between the source and the pixels parameter is confusing.

What did you expect to see?

I expect to see a description of what the source parameter means, and what types it expects.

Do you have any supporting links, references, or citations?

No response

Do you have anything more you want to share?

No response

item.title: [webgl1] SharedArrayBuffer is not usable as a source data parameter.
item.content:encoded:
MDN URL

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WebGLRenderingContext/bufferSubData

What specific section or headline is this issue about?

One of allowed argument types is not allowed.

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

The third argument of bufferSubData method is srcData and it needs to be one of allowed values which they are: ArrayBuffer, SharedArrayBuffer, DataView or a TypedArray But if SharedArrayBuffer is used then the TypeError is thrown with "the argument is not an ArrayBufferView" and this issue forces users to use and DataView or TypedArray for srcData argument.

Throws:
TypeError: Failed to execute 'bufferSubData' on 'WebGL2RenderingContext': parameter 3 is not of type 'ArrayBufferView'

What did you expect to see?

The khronos page says it is allowed to use the SharedArrayBuffers as a source data and it would be awesome if we can :)

Khronos abstract:
void bufferSubData (GLenum target, GLintptr offset, AllowSharedBufferSource data)

Do you have any supporting links, references, or citations?

The bufferSubData method's third parameter srcData links:
MDN: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WebGLRenderingContext/bufferSubData#srcdata
Khronos: https://registry.khronos.org/webgl/specs/latest/1.0/#5.14.5
OpenGL: https://registry.khronos.org/OpenGL-Refpages/es2.0/xhtml/glBufferSubData.xml

Do you have anything more you want to share?

Beautiful code that needs to be working:

The bug is hanging around and says u're not my type..

Then i changes my type for this little ..:

It works but i'm not feeling like won against the bug (in addition, i don't know why some chars -like a f or 1- is not shown properly. it could be another bug but i need to be sure before report as an issue).

I think if we merge our powers as humankind then we'll have a chance to defeat the bug, we started this war and we need to fight.. for the king! (can i be king for next time? pleaseee)

item.title: [WEBGL_depth_texture] Example code on WEBGL_depth_texture gives GL_INVALID_VALUE when run in WebGL 2
item.content:encoded:
MDN URL

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WEBGL_depth_texture

What specific section or headline is this issue about?

Examples

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

The example code calls

gl.texImage2D( gl.TEXTURE_2D, 0, gl.DEPTH_COMPONENT, 512, 512, 0, gl.DEPTH_COMPONENT, gl.UNSIGNED_SHORT, null );

which will throw a gl.INVALID_VALUE.

What did you expect to see?

The code should be modified by replacing the first gl.DEPTH_COMPONENT with gl.DEPTH_COMPONENT16.

Do you have any supporting links, references, or citations?

No response

Do you have anything more you want to share?

No response

MDN metadata

Page report details

item.title: [webgl2] texSubImage3D has wrong values for format param
item.content:encoded:
MDN URL

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WebGL2RenderingContext/texSubImage3D

What specific section or headline is this issue about?

format parameter

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

It lists a lot of invalid formats.

For example, lists gl.R8 but that is not valid, but g.RED is.

What did you expect to see?

The values seen in the OpenGL documentation: https://registry.khronos.org/OpenGL-Refpages/gl4/html/glTexSubImage3D.xhtml

Specifically:

GL_RED, GL_RG, GL_RGB, GL_BGR, GL_RGBA, GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT, and GL_STENCIL_INDEX

Do you have any supporting links, references, or citations?

https://registry.khronos.org/OpenGL-Refpages/gl4/html/glTexSubImage3D.xhtml

https://registry.khronos.org/webgl/specs/latest/2.0/#TEXTURE_TYPES_FORMATS_FROM_DOM_ELEMENTS_TABLE

Do you have anything more you want to share?

No response

MDN metadata

item.title: [webgl2, webgl1] vertexAttribPointer() type only accepts floating point types
item.content:encoded:
MDN URL

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WebGLRenderingContext/vertexAttribPointer

What specific section or headline is this issue about?

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WebGLRenderingContext/vertexAttribPointer#parameters

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

I tried using gl.UNSIGNED_INT but kept getting WebGL warning: drawArraysInstanced: Vertex attrib 0 requires data of type UINT, but is being supplied with type FLOAT. errors.

What did you expect to see?

Turns out I have to use https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WebGL2RenderingContext/vertexAttribIPointer instead for integer types.

Do you have any supporting links, references, or citations?

https://stackoverflow.com/a/17261259/866521

Do you have anything more you want to share?

No response

item.title: [webgl2] WebGL2RenderingContextÂ»texSubImage3D page: List of valid "format" parameter values does not match WebGL2 spec
item.content:encoded:
MDN URL

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WebGL2RenderingContext/texSubImage3D

What specific section or headline is this issue about?

Parameters

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

The "Parameters" section of the WebGL2RenderingContext.texSubImage3D() documentation appears to list values that do not agree with the documentation provided by Khronos. They also do not seem to agree with the values linked via the "WebGL 2.0 Specification 3.7.6" link under the "Specifications" section.

For example, Tables 1 & 2 of the glTexImage3D() method (indicated as the authoritative source of information regarding the legal combinations of the format and type parameters for WebGL2's texSubImage3D() method) include format values of e.g. GL_RED and GL_RED_INTEGER that are not listed in the MDN documentation for this method.

Furthermore, the MDN documentation claims that gl.R8, gl.R16F, gl.R32F etc are valid format parameters - but these values are not listed as valid format parameters by Khronos. Indeed, trying to use gl.R8 as a format parameter with a type parameter of gl.UNSIGNED_BYTE and uint8 source data produced the following error in Chrome:

WebGL: INVALID_ENUM: texSubImage3D: invalid format

... but using gl.RED_INTEGER (as per the Khronos specifications) fixed that error message.

What did you expect to see?

Values for format that agree with the Khronos documentation for this method.

Do you have any supporting links, references, or citations?

Khronos documentation for texSubImage3D : https://registry.khronos.org/webgl/specs/latest/2.0/#3.7.6

The documentation above links to the Khronos documentation for Tables 1 & 2 of the glTexImage3D() documentation:

https://registry.khronos.org/OpenGL-Refpages/es3.0/html/glTexImage3D.xhtml

These tables contain the "valid" values (and their combinations) for the format and type parameters of texSubImage3D().

Do you have anything more you want to share?

No response

MDN metadata

Page report details
  • Folder: en-us/web/api/webgl2renderingcontext/texsubimage3d
  • MDN URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WebGL2RenderingContext/texSubImage3D
  • GitHub URL: https://github.com/mdn/content/blob/main/files/en-us/web/api/webgl2renderingcontext/texsubimage3d/index.md
  • Last commit: 3381c87

Did you test this? If so, how?

item.title: [OVR_multiview2] WebXR guide material tracking issue
item.content:encoded:
(updated given Dominic's comment and more own thoughts)

Filing this bug to collect what kind of guide/tutorial content is missing in the WebXR docs. Planning to share this with subject matter experts and hopefully get some help with completing these pages

Landing pages

  • Brush up the MDN graphics landing page to be more useful and to talk about WebXR
  • Organize the WebXR Device API landing page better (list the interfaces more efficiently, put more focus on the tutorials)

Existing tutorials

  • Fundamentals of WebXR (to proof read to and get rid of "draft" banner)
  • WebXR application lifecycle (to complete)
  • Starting up and shutting down a WebXR Session (to proofread)
  • Geometry and reference spaces in WebXR (to proofread)
  • Spaces and reference spaces: Spatial tracking (to proofread, to complete, to remove draft banner)
  • Rendering and the WebXR frame animation callback (to proofread)
  • Viewpoints and viewers: Simulating cameras (to proofread)
  • Lighting a WebXR setting (to proofread and possible expand for Lighting Estimation module)
  • Using bounded reference spaces (to be completed, to proofread, to remove draft banner)
  • Movement, orientation, and motion (to proofread)
  • Targeting and Hit detection (to be completed, talk about Hit Testing Module)
  • WebXR performance guide (to be completed)
    • Talk about foveate rendering (rendering more cheaply at lower resolution in the periphery of the view), refresh rates (there's some documentation here but I don't think it covers requesting low and high refresh rates, the refresh rate API, and what to do in practice to monitor and manage refresh rate), multiview.
  • WebXR permissions and security (to complete; MDN still needs to document the Permission-Policy header, still documents this as Feature-Policy -> side project; talk about secure origin requirement)

New tutorials to write

  • Using WebXR input profiles. Cover Hands Input profile
  • Gamecontroller (Gamepad API) in WebXR
  • WebXR Layers / Playing video in a 3D environment
  • First person observer / secondary views (#7153 (comment)). Maybe integrate this aspect into the "Viewports and viewers" article?)
  • Depth Information
  • Positional audio in a 3D environment (not integrated into WebXR, address this topic later, remove from landing page)
